Patient 6: A 52-year-old female with a history of rheumatoid arthritis and fibromyalgia. She has been on methotrexate and hydroxychloroquine for several years, with occasional use of prednisone during flare-ups. Her medication list also includes gabapentin for neuropathic pain and duloxetine for chronic pain management. She has a family history of autoimmune disorders, including lupus in her mother. She reports an allergy to penicillin, which causes a rash.
